what: Example 1: generate a dataset from a database
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume database called myDb folder named dbFolder willing generate standardized dataset several scenarios: scen1, scen2, scen3. generate_report function, generated automatically saved folder myDb . Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Load gcamreport library. Store database path name, query path, desired project name, desired scenarios reporting variables variables. case specify scenarios, scenarios database considered reporting; variables specified, available reporting variables used. details scenarios variables specification, look regions’ tutorial variables’ tutorial. Notice extension included project name. Accepted extensions: .dat & .proj. Note: case followed Docker installation, store database inside gcamreport folder root directory called /app. Thus, database path something like /app/path//database. Generate dataset desired year. example, 2050. default 2100 least 2025. Note: project generation requires approximately 30 minutes. Notice dataset automatically saved .RData, .csv .xlsx /path//database/awesomeProj_standardized.RData, /path//database/awesomeProj_standardized.csv, /path//database/awesomeProj_standardized.xlsx. procedure also generate project file /path//database/dbname_prjname.dat necessary queries need reporting. can directly use indicated Example 2. terminal output performed verifications final status. newline
code: devtools::load_all() dbpath <- "/path/to/database" dbname <- "gcamdb_name" prjname <- "awesomeProj.dat" scen <- c('scen1', 'scen2', 'scen3') generate_report(db_path = dbpath, query_path = querypath, db_name = dbname,                  prj_name = prjname, scenarios = scen, final_year = 2050,                  launch_ui = FALSE)

what: Example 2: generate a dataset from a project
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume project called myProj.dat willing generate standardized dataset . generate_report function, generated automatically saved folder myProj.dat . Notice myProj.dat required queries standardized dataset generation. sure need generate project, see Example1. Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Load gcamreport library. Store project path desired scenarios reporting variables variables. case specify scenarios, scenarios database considered reporting; variables specified, available reporting variables used. details scenarios variables specification, look regions’ tutorial variables’ tutorial. Notice extension included. Accepted extensions: .dat & .proj. Note: case followed Docker installation, store database inside gcamreport folder root directory called /app. Thus, database path something like /app/path//database. Generate dataset desired year. example, 2050. default 2100 least 2025. Notice dataset automatically saved .RData, .csv .xlsx /path//project/myProj_standardized.RData, /path//project/myProj_standardized.csv, /path//project/myProj_standardized.xlsx. terminal output performed verifications final status. newline
code: devtools::load_all() mypath <- "/path/to/project/myProj.dat" scen <- c('scen1', 'scen2', 'scen3') generate_report(project_path = mypath, scenarios = scen, final_year = 2050,                  launch_ui = FALSE)

what: Example 3: save or not the output and specify the file format or the directory
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume situation previous examples want either save output, save .csv, .xlsx, extensions. Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Load gcamreport library. Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters like consider generate_report function (e.g., final year, desired scenarios…). Specify output saving options save_output parameter Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters consider generate_report function. Specify output directory output file name file_name parameter. save output indicated path .csv .xlsx. modify , see explanation. newline
code: devtools::load_all() ## -- save the dataset in CSV and XLSX format generate_report(..., save_output = TRUE)    # this is the default option  ## -- save the dataset only in CSV format generate_report(..., save_output = 'CSV')  ## -- save the dataset only in XLSX format generate_report(..., save_output = 'XLSX')  ## -- do not save the dataset generate_report(..., save_output = FALSE) ## -- save the dataset in '/desired/directory' and in a file called 'awesomeOutput' generate_report(..., file_name = '/desired/directory/awesomeOutput')

what: Example 4: specify the regions or regions’ group/s
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume situation previous examples want consider regions. two options select : can directly specify desired regions consider can specify regions’ group/s consider. case, desired regions make World. , example, World’s total crop land sum crop land picked regions. Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Load gcamreport library. Check available regions regions’ groups. following commands print list possibilities. case want save vector, can simply assign output. can also skip regions’ console printing setting print = FALSE. Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters consider generate_report function (e.g., final final, desired scenarios…). Specify regions desired_regions parameter regions’ group desired_continents parameter. Notice can specified time. newline
code: devtools::load_all() available_regions() available_continents() avail_reg <- available_regions(print = FALSE) avail_cont <- available_continents() ## -- specify the desired regions generate_report(..., desired_regions = c('EU-15','EU-12'))  ## -- specify the desired regions' group/s generate_report(..., desired_continents = c('ASIA','REF'))

title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume situation previous examples want consider variables. Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Load gcamreport library. Check available variables. following command print list possibilities. case want save vector, can simply assign output. can also skip variables’ console printing setting print = FALSE. Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters consider generate_report function (e.g, final year, desired scenarios…). Specify variables desired_variables parameter. can specify vector desired variables names fully written, also consider variables start name. last feature, allows easily select variables within group, Emissions, Emissions|CO2, Agricultural Demand case specify variables within group, make total value. example, select Final Energy|Electricity Final Energy|Gases, Final Energy sum two sectors, consider Final Energy|Industry Final Energy|Heat. newline
code: devtools::load_all() available_variables() avail_var <- available_variables(print = FALSE) ## -- specify the desired variables generate_report(...,                desired_variables = c('Agricultural Demand|Crops|Energy',                                     'Agricultural Demand|Crops|Feed',                                     'Capacity Additions|Electricity|Wind|Onshore',                                      'Emissions|BC|Energy*')) # This will select,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy|Demand|Industry,                                                               # Emissions|BC|Energy|Demand|Residential and Commercial,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy|Demand|Transportation,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy|Supply

what: A) Error on generate_report considering a database
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: running generate_report(db_path = "path///database", db_name = "database_name", prj_name = "project_name.dat"), might see error R console: running generate_report("path///data/myData.dat"), might see error R console: problem might due incorrect package installation incorrect database placement. Possible solution 1: make sure cloned repo. Check instructions . Possible solution 2: make sure placed database folder specifying. can , extracted database zip folder, intermediate folder appeared. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance db_path = C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\database using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure database inside gcamreport folder. make sure typed correctly path gcamreport folder generating docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly database. example, gcamreport folder folder called some_databases database amazingDatabase, refer newline
code: > generate_report("path/to/your/data/myData.dat") [1] "Creating project..." /home/user/basex/.basex: writing new configuration file. Error in localDBConn(db_path, db_name, migabble = FALSE) :    Database does not exist or is invalid: examples/database_basexdb_ref In addition: Warning messages: 1: In normalizePath(dbPath) :   path[1]="examples": No such file or directory 2: The following named parsers don't match the column names: name, date, version # option 1: full path generate_report(db_path = "/app/some_databases", db_name = "amazingDatabase")  # option 2: partial path generate_report(db_path = "some_databases", db_name = "amazingDatabase")

what: B) Error on generate_report considering a project
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: running generate_report("path///data/myData.dat"), might see error R console: problem due wrong path specification. Possible solution: make sure specified correctly path. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\data\myData.dat using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure data inside gcamreport folder. make sure typed correctly path gcamreport folder generating docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly data. example, gcamreport folder folder called amazingData dataset myData.dat, refer newline
code: > generate_report("path/to/your/data/myData.dat") [1] "Loading project..." [1] "Loading data, performing checks, and saving output..." [1] "ag_demand_clean" Error in rgcam::getQuery(prj, "demand balances by crop commodity") :   getQuery: Query demand balances by crop commodity is not in any scenarios in the data set. # option 1: full path generate_report("/app/amazingData/myData.dat")  # option 2: partial path generate_report("amazingData/myData.dat")

what: C) Error related to system when using the Docker installation.
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: R console opened, might see message introducing command: Possible solution: simply type Ctrl+C run command .
code: System has not been booted with systemd as init system (PID 1). Can't operate. Failed to connect to bus: Host is down Warning message: In system("timedatectl", intern = TRUE) :    running command 'timedatectl' had status 1

what: Example 1: generate a dataset from a database
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Assume database called myDb folder named dbFolder willing generate standardized dataset several scenarios: scen1, scen2, scen3. run function, generated automatically saved folder myDb . Load gcamreport library. Store database path name, query path, desired project name, considered scenarios variables. Notice extension included project name. Accepted extensions: .dat & .proj. Note: case followed Docker installation, store database inside gcamreport folder root directory called /app. Thus, database path something like /app/path//database. Generate dataset desired year. example, 2050. default 2100 least 2025. Note: project generation requires approximately 30 minutes. Notice dataset automatically saved .csv .xlsx /path//database/awesomeProj_iamc_report.csv /path//database/awesomeProj_iamc_report.xlsx. procedure generate project file /path//database/dbname_prjname.dat necessary queries can use indicated Example 2. terminal output performed verifications final status. newline
code: library(gcamreport) dbpath <- "/path/to/database" dbname <- "gcamdb_name" prjname <- "awesomeProj.dat" scen <- c('scen1', 'scen2', 'scen3') run(db_path = dbpath, query_path = querypath, db_name = dbname, prj_name = prjname, scenarios = scen, final_year = 2050, launch_ui = FALSE)

what: Example 2: launch UI once the dataset has been generated
title: Interactive UI Tutorial
text: generating .RData dataset generate_report() function, simply run launch_gcamreport_ui R specifying either dataset variable path .RData dataset. something like /path///database/..._standardize.RData /path///project_file/..._standardize.RData. newline
code: # lanuch the user interface specifying the dataset variable name launch_gcamreport_ui(data = "report") # report is the name of the standardized                                        # dataset generated by generate_report()                                        # function. So, if you see it loaded in                                        # your environment, you can easily use                                        # it here!! :)  # lanuch the user interface specifying the dataset path launch_gcamreport_ui(data_path = /path/to/your/database/..._standardize.RData)

what: Example 1: step-by-step to add a new mapping item - AvocadoSeeds and AvocadoSeedsTrees
title: Modify Mappings and Template Tutorial
text: example, assume GCAM version detailed land-food system reports new food item called AvocadoSeeds new land-leaf called AvocadoSeedsTrees. Thus, need modify gcamreport include items reporting dataset. example, new items add final cropland area several pollutant emissions, category template. Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Open gcamreport.Rprj. modify mappings, best relay similar item already present mappings. case, relay NutsSeeds NutsSeedsTree. see mapping modifications performed, search across files (Ctrl + Shift + F) inside inst/extdata/mappings key words NutsSeeds NutsSeedsTree. Using previous point method, can see add lines following files stored inst/extdata/mappings: ag_prices_map.csv. Add line: Kyotogas_sector.csv. Add lines: land_use_map.csv. Add line nonCO2_emissions_sector_map.csv. Add lines Update queries file (necessary, example). , open inst/extdata/queries/queries_gcamreport_gcam7.0_complete.xml add lines aggregated land allocation query. Update pre-build mappings: Run file inst/extdata/saveDataFiles.R. Build document file: press Ctrl + Shift + D. Install modified package: Build > install. forget push changes branch tag new version allow reproducibility reusability!! :) newline
code: AvocadoTrees,,,,,,,,,1 CH4,AWB,AvocadoTrees,Emissions|Kyoto Gases,Emissions|Kyoto Gases|AFOLU,,,,,,,,,1 N2O,AGR,AvocadoTrees,Emissions|Kyoto Gases,Emissions|Kyoto Gases|AFOLU,,,,,,,,,1 N2O,AWB,AvocadoTrees,Emissions|Kyoto Gases,Emissions|Kyoto Gases|AFOLU,,,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,Land Cover,Land Cover|Cropland,,,,,,,0.1 AvocadoTreesTree,Land Cover,Land Cover|Cropland,,,,,,,0.1 AvocadoTrees,BC_AWB,Emissions|BC,Emissions|BC|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,CH4_AWB,Emissions|CH4,Emissions|CH4|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,CO_AWB,Emissions|CO,Emissions|CO|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,N2O_AGR,Emissions|N2O,Emissions|N2O|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,N2O_AWB,Emissions|N2O,Emissions|N2O|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,NH3_AGR,Emissions|NH3,Emissions|NH3|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,NH3_AWB,Emissions|NH3,Emissions|NH3|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,NMVOC_AWB,Emissions|NMVOC,Emissions|NMVOC|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,NOx_AGR,Emissions|NOx,Emissions|NOx|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,NOx_AWB,Emissions|NOx,Emissions|NOx|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,OC_AWB,Emissions|OC,Emissions|OC|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,SO2_1_AWB,Emissions|Sulfur,Emissions|Sulfur|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,SO2_2_AWB,Emissions|Sulfur,Emissions|Sulfur|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,SO2_3_AWB,Emissions|Sulfur,Emissions|Sulfur|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 AvocadoTrees,SO2_4_AWB,Emissions|Sulfur,Emissions|Sulfur|AFOLU,,,,,,,1 <rewrite from="AvocadoSeeds" to="crops" /> <rewrite from="AvocadoSeedsTree" to="crops" />

what: Example 2: step-by-step to add/modify a template item - Energy Service|Transportation|Freight|Bicycling and Walking
title: Modify Mappings and Template Tutorial
text: example, assume GCAM version detailed energy transportation freight service considers Bicycling Walking. want include report new item: Energy Service|Transportation|Passenger|Bicycling Walking. , need modify reporting template. Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Open gcamreport.Rprj. modify reporting template, best relay similar item already present mappings. case, relay Energy Service|Transportation|Freight|Road. see reporting template modifications performed, open reporting template file (inst/extdata/template/reporting_template.csv) search (Ctrl + F) key words Energy Service|Transportation|Freight|Road. Using previous point method, can see add one line reporting template: contains following columns: GCAM version, item name, units, internal variable storing value. Update pre-build reporting template: Run file inst/extdata/saveDataFiles.R. Build document file: press Ctrl + Shift + D. Install modified package: Build > install. forget push changes branch tag new version allow reproducibility reusability!! :)

text: ATTENTION: README compatible gcamreport v6.0*, .e, gcamreport v6.0.0, gcamreport v6.0.1, gcamreport v6.0.0-gas releases. releases, please check Tutorials drop-menu home icon main bar. newline

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Contents Introduction Installation Guide R Docker Getting Started Warning Error Messages

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Back Contents gcamreport tool generates consistent dataset scenario run Global Change Analysis Model (GCAM), meets reporting requirements Integrated Assessment Modeling Consortium (IAMC). Additionally, gcamreport includes interactive user widget allows users create download plots, well download reduced versions formated dataset table format.

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Back Contents two equivalent possibilities make use package:

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Requirements R (download click ) Rstudio (download click ) Git (download click ) `` Open git bash folder want clone repository clone specifying branch tag. specify branch (gcam-v6.0 gcam-v6.0-gas): specify tag (v6.0.0, v6.0.1 v6.0.0-gas): Load gcamreport package. two options: Open gcamreport folder just cloned double-click gcamreport.Rproj file. RStudio open project. Load library: Open Rstudio (matter Rproject) load library spcifying branch tag:  Now gcamreport package fully loaded. Enjoy! :smile:
code: git clone -b <branch name> https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git git checkout tags/<tag name> install.packages('devtools') devtools::load_all() install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport@<branch or tag name>") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport)

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Requirements Docker (download click ) Git (download click ) Open git bash folder want clone repository clone specifying branch tag. specify branch (gcam-v6.0 gcam-v6.0-gas): specify tag (v6.0.0, v6.0.1 v6.0.0-gas): Open Docker Desktop (double-click icon computer) leave running background. Inside terminal (bash cmd) pull docker image: Note: step requires 13.5GB free space computer. Run Docker container using full path gcamreport folder: prompt R terminal console. Install gcamreport package spcifying branch tag new R console: Note: local files accessed must inside gcamreport folder, considered now root directory R session. Inside R session, referred /app. Note: use docker image, can simply run steps 3, 5 6, since docker image already computer. Now gcamreport package fully loaded. Enjoy! :smile:
code: git clone -b <branch name> https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git git checkout tags/<tag name> docker pull claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:v3 docker run -v /path/to/gcamreport:/app -p 4000:3838 -it claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:v3 remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport@<branch or tag name>") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport)

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Back Contents gcamreport package consists set functions divided two different blocks: Dataset generation: creates loads existing project automatically saves generated dataset meets reporting requirements IAMC. Main function: run(). information look tutorial type ?run R console. obtain warning error messages, might useful look Warning Error Messages section. Interactive user block: launches interactive widget display table format dataset, possibility filter, reorder, download live. Moreover, displays plots allows downloaded, aggregated variables, regions, scenarios. Main function: launch_gcamreport_ui(). information look tutorial type ?launch_gcamreport_ui R console. obtain warning error messages, might useful look Warning Error Messages section. Note: followed Docker installation, open user interface (UI) launched, either go Docker Desktop type last started port, type http://localhost:4000 browser.  addition, package includes default input files (.Rda), read different functions. can changed user. constants include energy shares, land shares, others.

title: README for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Back Contents typical already-known errors can easily solved! :bulb: ) Error “run(”path///data/myData.dat”)” R console, might see error: problem due wrong path specification. Thus, make sure specified correctly path. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\data\myData.dat using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure data inside gcamreport folder. make sure type correctly path gcamreport folder running docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly data. example, gcamreport folder folder called amazingData dataset myData.dat, refer  B) Wired message launching UI using Docker installation. using functions run() launch_gcamreport_ui() launch UI, might get message: error! simply need either go Docker Desktop program click last started port  open url http://localhost:4000 favourite browser.  C) Error using UI Docker installation. oppening localhost, might see error:  UI running. Try either use run() function launch_gcamreport_ui().  D) Error related system using Docker installation. R console opened, might see message introducing command: Simply type Ctrl+C run command .

what: Example 1: step-by-step standardized dataset generation from a provided database
title: Step-by-step full example
text: Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker. Download example GCAM7.0 database, store inside gcamreport/examples, unpack . Make sure database directly located gcamreport/examples/database_basexdb_ref intermediate folder appeared. Generate standardized dataset: case expirence trouble, check troubleshooting section. project generated standardized dataset created, user interface prompt. using R Studio, automatically open. better experience, click open browser button. using Docker, either type http://localhost:4000 browser go Docker Desktop click last started port.  Check generated dataset: look examples folder see file called example1_standardized.csv file called example1_standardized.xlsx containing standardized dataset. Notice examples folder file called database_basexdb_ref_example1.dat appeared. generated project file provided database. case want generate standardized dataset open user interface, can use directly file avoid creating project . wish proceed mentioned, can follow Example 2. Notice examples folder file called example1_standardized.RData appeared. generated reporting file provided database. case want launch user interface future, can use directly file avoid creating loading project . wish proceed mentioned, can follow Example 3. newline
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. devtools::load_all()  ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. dbpath <- "examples" dbname <- "database_basexdb_ref" scen <- "Reference"  ## -- choose a project name prjname <- "example1.dat"  ## -- generate the reporting dataset until 2050 for EU-12 and EU-15 for all the  ## -- Agricultural variables, save the output in .RData, .csv and .xlsx format,  ## -- and lunch the user interface generate_report(db_path = dbpath, db_name = dbname, scenarios = scen,                  prj_name = prjname, final_year = 2050,                  desired_regions = c('EU-12', 'EU-15'),                  desired_variables = c('Agricultural*'),                  save_output = TRUE, launch_ui = TRUE)

what: Example 2: step-by-step standardized dataset generation from a provided project
title: Step-by-step full example
text: Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker example use example dataset stored examples called example2.dat Generate standardized dataset: case expirence trouble, check troubleshooting section. project generated standardized dataset created, user interface prompt. using R Studio, automatically open. better experience, click open browser button. using Docker, either type http://localhost:4000 browser go Docker Desktop click last started port.  Check generated dataset: look examples folder see file called example2_standardized.csv file called example2_standardized.xlsx containing standardized dataset. Notice examples folder file called example2_standardized.RData appeared. generated reporting file provided database. case want launch user interface future, can use directly file avoid creating loading project . wish proceed mentioned, can follow Example 3. newline
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. devtools::load_all()  ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. projectpath <- "examples/example2.dat"  ## -- generate the reporting dataset until 2050 for EU-12 and EU-15 for all the  ## -- Agricultural variables, save the output in .RData, .csv and .xlsx format,  ## -- and lunch the user interface generate_report(project_path = projectpath, final_year = 2050,                  desired_regions = c('EU-12', 'EU-15'),                 desired_variables = c('Agricultural*'),                  save_output = TRUE, launch_ui = TRUE)

what: Example 3: step-by-step user interface launching from a provided standardized dataset
title: Step-by-step full example
text: Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker example use example dataset stored examples called example3.RData Launch user interface standardized dataset: case expirence trouble, check troubleshooting section. project generated standardized dataset created, user interface prompt. using R Studio, automatically open. better experience, click open browser button. using Docker, either type http://localhost:4000 browser go Docker Desktop click last started port.  case just run Example 1 Example 2, environemnt variable called report. can use launch user interface:
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. devtools::load_all()  ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. datapath <- "examples/example3.RData"  ## -- launch the user interface launch_gcamreport_ui(data_path = datapath) ## -- load gcamreport library. library(gcamreport)  ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. dataname <- "report"  ## -- launch the user interface launch_gcamreport_ui(data = dataname)

what: Example 1: step-by-step standardized dataset generation from a provided database
title: Step By Step Full Example for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker Download example GCAM6.0 database, store inside gcamreport/examples, unpack . Generate standardized dataset: Note: project generation requires approximately 30 minutes. project generated standardized dataset created, user interface prompt. using R Studio, automatically open. better experience, click open browser button. using Docker, either type http://localhost:4000 browser go Docker Desktop click last started port.  Check generated dataset: look examples folder see file called example1_iamc_report.csv file called example1_iamc_report.xlsx containing standardized dataset. Notice examples folder file called database_basexdb_ref_example1.dat appeared. generated project file provided database. case want generate standardized dataset open user interface, can use directly file avoid creating project . whish proceed mentioned, can follow Example 2. newline
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. library(gcamreport)  ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. dbpath <- "examples" dbname <- "database_basexdb_ref" scen <- "Reference"  ## -- choose a project name prjname <- "example1.dat"  ## -- generate the dataset until 2025, save the output in .csv and .xlsx format, and lunch the user interface run(db_path = dbpath, db_name = dbname, scenarios = scen, prj_name = prjname, final_year = 2025, save_output = TRUE, launch_ui = TRUE)

what: Example 2: step-by-step standardized dataset generation from a provided project
title: Step By Step Full Example for gcamreport v6.0*
text: Follow installation guide either R Studio Docker example use example dataset stored examples called example2.dat Generate standardized dataset: project generated standardized dataset created, user interface prompt. using R Studio, automatically open. better experience, click open browser button. using Docker, either type http://localhost:4000 browser go Docker Desktop click last started port.  Check generated dataset: look examples folder see file called example2_iamc_report.csv file called example2_iamc_report.xlsx containing standardized dataset.
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. library(gcamreport)  ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. projectpath <- "examples/example2.dat"  ## -- generate the dataset until 2025, save the output in .csv and .xlsx format, and lunch the user interface run(project_path = projectpath, final_year = 2025, save_output = TRUE, launch_ui = TRUE)

title: gcamreport
text: Contents Introduction Installation Guide R Docker Getting Started Warning Error Messages

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents gcamreport tool generates consistent dataset scenario run Global Change Analysis Model (GCAM), meets reporting requirements Integrated Assessment Modeling Consortium (IAMC). Additionally, gcamreport includes interactive user widget allows users create download plots, well download reduced versions formated dataset table format.

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents two equivalent possibilities make use package:

title: gcamreport
text: Requirements R (download click ) Rstudio (download click ) Git (download click ) Open git bash folder want clone repository clone : Load gcamreport package. two options: Open gcamreport folder just cloned double-click gcamreport.Rproj file. RStudio open project. Load library: Open Rstudio (matter Rproject) load library:  Now gcamreport package fully loaded. Enjoy! 😄
code: git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git install.packages('devtools') devtools::load_all() install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport)

title: gcamreport
text: Requirements Docker (download click ) Git (download click ) Open git bash folder want clone repository clone : Open Docker Desktop (double-click icon computer) leave running background. Inside terminal (bash cmd) pull docker image: Note❗: step requires 13.5GB free space computer. Run Docker container using full path gcamreport folder: prompt R terminal console. Install gcamreport package new R console: Note❗: local files accessed must inside gcamreport folder, considered now root directory R session. Inside R session, referred /app. Note❗: use docker image, can simply run steps 3, 5 6, since docker image already computer. Now gcamreport package fully loaded. Enjoy! 😄
code: git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git docker pull claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:gcam-v7.0-v1 docker run -v /path/to/gcamreport:/app -p 4000:3838 -it claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:gcam-v7.0-v1 remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport)

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents gcamreport package consists set functions divided two different blocks: Dataset generation: creates loads existing project automatically saves generated dataset meets reporting requirements IAMC. Main function: generate_report(). information look tutorial type ?generate_report R console. obtain warning error messages, might useful look Warning Error Messages section. Interactive user block: launches interactive widget display table format dataset, possibility filter, reorder, download live. Moreover, displays plots allows downloaded, aggregated variables, regions, scenarios. Main function: launch_gcamreport_ui(). information look tutorial type ?launch_gcamreport_ui R console. obtain warning error messages, might useful look Warning Error Messages section. Note❗: followed Docker installation, open user interface (UI) launched, either go Docker Desktop type last started port, type http://localhost:4000 browser.  addition, package includes default input files (.Rda), read different functions. can changed user. constants include energy shares, land shares, others.

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents typical already-known errors can easily solved! 💡 💻 Error “run(”path///data/myData.dat”)” R console, might see error: problem due wrong path specification. Thus, make sure specified correctly path. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\data\myData.dat using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure data inside gcamreport folder. make sure type correctly path gcamreport folder running docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly data. example, gcamreport folder folder called amazingData dataset myData.dat, refer  💻 Wired message launching UI using Docker installation. using functions generate_report() launch_gcamreport_ui() launch UI, might get message: error! simply need either go Docker Desktop program click last started port  open url http://localhost:4000 favourite browser.  💻 Error using UI Docker installation. oppening localhost, might see error:  UI running. Try either use generate_report() function launch_gcamreport_ui().  💻 Error related system using Docker installation. R console opened, might see message introducing command: Simply type Ctrl+C run command .
code: > generate_report("path/to/your/data/myData.dat")   [1] "Loading project..."   [1] "Loading data, performing checks, and saving output..."   [1] "ag_demand_clean"   Error in rgcam::getQuery(prj, "demand balances by crop commodity") :     getQuery: Query demand balances by crop commodity is not in any scenarios in the data set. # option 1: full path   generate_report("/app/amazingData/myData.dat")      # option 2: partial path   generate_report("amazingData/myData.dat") Listening on http://0.0.0.0:3838   /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: www-browser: not found   /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: links2: not found   /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: elinks: not found   /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: links: not found   /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: lynx: not found   /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: w3m: not found   xdg-open: no method available for opening 'http://127.0.0.1:3838' System has not been booted with systemd as init system (PID 1). Can't operate.   Failed to connect to bus: Host is down   Warning message:   In system("timedatectl", intern = TRUE) :      running command 'timedatectl' had status 1

title: create_project — create_project
text: db_path path database. db_name name database. prj_name name project. scenarios name scenarios considered. default, scenarios database considered. desired_regions desired regions consider. default, ''. Otherwise, specify vector considered regions. know possible regions, run `available_regions()`. ATTENTION: considered regions make "World". case project dataset needs created, produced specified regions. desired_variables desired variables report. Considered '' default. Otherwise, specify vector desired options. know possible options, run `available_variables()`. case project dataset needs created, produced specified variables. ATTENTION: global variables "Emissions" computed considering selected variables, instance "Emissions|CO2", account variables, "Emissions|CH4" "Emissions|NH3".

title: generate_report — generate_report
text: Main function. Creates/loads GCAM project, standardizes data saves several forms (RData, CSV, XLSX), runs vetting verifications, launches User Interface. can specify regions /variables reported point either `project_path`, `db_path`, `db_name`, `prj_name`, `scenarios`. resulting RData output can used manually call `launch_gcamreport_ui`.

title: generate_report — generate_report
code: generate_report(   project_path = NULL,   db_path = NULL,   db_name = NULL,   prj_name = NULL,   scenarios = NULL,   final_year = 2100,   desired_variables = "All",   desired_regions = "All",   desired_continents = "All",   save_output = TRUE,   output_file = NULL,   launch_ui = TRUE )

title: generate_report — generate_report
text: project_path full path project project name. Possible extensions: .dat .proj. db_path full path database. db_name name database. prj_name name project. scenarios name scenarios considered. default, scenarios project database considered. final_year final year data. default = 2100. ATENTION: final_year must least 2025. desired_variables desired variables report. Considered '' default. Otherwise, specify vector desired options. know possible options, run `available_variables()`. case project dataset needs created, created containing specified variables. ATTENTION: global variables "Emissions" computed considering selected variables. example, select "Emissions" "Emissions|CO2", "Emissions" account "Emissions|CO2", consider variables, "Emissions|CH4" "Emissions|NH3" desired_regions desired regions consider. default, ''. Otherwise, specify vector considered regions. know possible regions, run `available_regions()`. ATTENTION: considered regions make "World". case project dataset needs created, produced specified regions. desired_continents desired continents/regions' groups consider. default, ''. Otherwise, specify vector considered continents/regions' groups. know possibilities, run `available_continents()`. ATTENTION: considered continents/regions' groups make "World". case project dataset needs created, produced specified continents/regions' groups. save_output TRUE, save reporting data CSV XLSX formats. FALSE, save data. 'save_output = CSV' 'save_output = XLSX', data saved specified format. output_file file path name saved data. used data saved. default, saved directory database project file, using default name containing project name 'standardized' tag. case specifying `output_file`, introduce whole path (e.g. /path//output/fileName) without extension tag, automatically added. launch_ui TRUE, launch User Interface, launch otherwise.

title: generate_report — generate_report
text: RData, CSV, XLSX datafile desired variables & launches user interface.

title: gcamreport 7.0.0
text: gcamreport package suitable GCAM 7.0 💥 Novelties: -Updated mappings meet GCAM 7.0 novelties. -Allow selection regions variables. -Add user error checks. -Simplify UI launch. -Rename functions make intuitive. -Fix: Report calculated elements. -Improve documentation.

title: gcamreport 6.0.1
text: gcamreport package suitable GCAM 6.0 💥 Novelties: -Fix project creation. -Introduce user messages. -Add step--step tutorial tutorial examples.

title: gcamreport 6.0.0-gas
text: gcamreport package suitable GCAM 6.0 extra gas features 💥 Novelties: -Mapping update meet new GCAM version requirements (detailed gas trading features).

title: gcamreport 6.0.0
text: gcamreport package suitable GCAM 6.0 💥 Novelties: -Creation template desired project following IPCC requirements. -Friendly UI view subset data items table, well plot desired variables choosing desired regions scenarios.
